fix eclipse warnings

DateFormat: The ability to set the date format in the build loop has been removed. This fixes the issue where setting the date format on one project would affect all of them (CC-355), would cause build status messages to not display in the reporting application (CC-797). Build loop now uses ISO 8601 format for storing date stamp information (CC-353) which is a change from the previous default format.

DateFormat: The ability to set the date format in the build loop has been removed. clarify that default date format changed
update unit test for core Date format changes

Updates for date format changes - remove refs to log4j classes in DateUtil class. Required now that DateUtil is used directly in reporting apps (where log4j is not available). @todo Find alternative "logging" approach for classes used where log4j may not be available

Updates for date format changes - remove refs to log4j classes in DateUtil class. Required now that DateUtil is used directly in reporting apps (where log4j is not available). @todo Find alternative "logging" approach for classes used where log4j may not be available
avoid duplicate call of Info.getProgressMsg()
reorganizing build file a bit. renaming default target 'dist'
minor reformatting

add new getters for plan text (not date prefix) and raw Date object on Progress interface. Done to break implict coupling to date format of currentBuildStatus. (getValue() and getText() are goofy, but don't want to change behavior of getValue() to preserve backwards compatibility.)

add new getters for plan text (not date prefix) and raw Date object on Progress interface. Done to break implict coupling to date format of currentBuildStatus. (getValue() and getText() are goofy, but don't want to change behavior of getValue() to preserve backwards compatibility.)

BuildStatus: Add attribute 'vetoIfFailing'. Will abort the build if the project being monitored had the last build fail (CC-842).
BuildStatus: Add attribute 'vetoIfFailing'. Will abort the build if the project being monitored had the last build fail (CC-842).
BuildStatus: Add attribute 'vetoIfFailing'. Will abort the build if the project being monitored had the last build fail (CC-842).

CVS: Add attribute skipEmailsFetching for people who don't have CVSROOT/users and don't want the (harmless) messages in the log when that file isn't found (CC-841). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki
CVS: Add attribute skipEmailsFetching for people who don't have CVSROOT/users and don't want the (harmless) messages in the log when that file isn't found (CC-841). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki

should we remove the unused group attribute from Builder?
don't allow negative values for time
don't allow negative values for time
Fixed a bug where time builders could be hidden by a multiple builder earlier in the file (CC-839). Now Builders are evaluated by time, then by multiple and then by day.
Fixed a bug where time builders could be hidden by a multiple builder earlier in the file (CC-839). Now Builders are evaluated by time, then by multiple and then by day.

fix typo of wrong file name (CC-835). Reported by Jurgen Mossgraber
ArtifactsPublisher: Add option to move instead of copy artifacts which can save time (CC-833). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki.
ArtifactsPublisher: Add option to move instead of copy artifacts which can save time (CC-833). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki.
ArtifactsPublisher: Add option to move instead of copy artifacts which can save time (CC-833). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki.
ArtifactsPublisher: Add option to move instead of copy artifacts which can save time (CC-833). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki.

ModificationSet: When there are multiple source controls attempt to merge conflicting properties by choosing the 'largest' value, to address situation where multiple source controls should return the newest version number or date (CC-830).

ModificationSet: When there are multiple source controls attempt to merge conflicting properties by choosing the 'largest' value, to address situation where multiple source controls should return the newest version number or date (CC-830).

ModificationSet: When there are multiple source controls attempt to merge conflicting properties by choosing the 'largest' value, to address situation where multiple source controls should return the newest version number or date (CC-830).
Dashboard: Fix bug where tests that took > 1000 seconds would cause an exception that prevented the build detail page from displaying (CC-828).

CompositeBuilder: Improve processing of build results to make it faster with large log files (CC-826). Patch by David Webster.
CompositeBuilder: Improve processing of build results to make it faster with large log files (CC-826). Patch by David Webster.
Dashboard: Added ability for users to override the maximum artifact file size that can be viewed without downloading by setting the context parameter 'download.threshhold' (CC-821).
Dashboard: Added ability for users to override the maximum artifact file size that can be viewed without downloading by setting the context parameter 'download.threshhold' (CC-821).

CVS: Add attribute 'recurseLocalWorkingCopy' which allows localWorkingCopy to point at a directory not under version control; reduces effort when project has multiple projects in parallel directories under a non-versioned root (CC-820). Based on patch by Detlef Keil.

CVS: Add attribute 'recurseLocalWorkingCopy' which allows localWorkingCopy to point at a directory not under version control; reduces effort when project has multiple projects in parallel directories under a non-versioned root (CC-820). Based on patch by Detlef Keil.

add note that we're moving JDK to 1.5

CruiseControlConfig: LabelIncrementers are no longer special cased, they are now treated like any other plugin. They must now be added to a project to get a non-default label incrementer and they can be registered with any name; are no longer forced to be named 'labelincrementer'. You can no longer set the labelincrementer classname via JMX. This change is not backwards compatible for users that were registering an alternative label incrementer but not placing the <labelincrementer> element in each project.

CruiseControlConfig: LabelIncrementers are no longer special cased, they are now treated like any other plugin. They must now be added to a project to get a non-default label incrementer and they can be registered with any name; are no longer forced to be named 'labelincrementer'. You can no longer set the labelincrementer classname via JMX. This change is not backwards compatible for users that were registering an alternative label incrementer but not placing the <labelincrementer> element in each project.

They must now be added to a project to get a non-default label incrementer and they can be registered with any name; are no longer forced to be named 'labelincrementer'. You can no longer set the labelincrementer classname via JMX. This change is not backwards compatible for users that were registering an alternative label incrementer but not placing the <labelincrementer> element in each project.
